ReviewList.Text: I'm currently brushing up on my chemistry skills for my upcoming AP Chem exam, and I have to say this is a great study tool! It's simply and prudently written, so if I need to be refreshed on a concept, I can easily navigate to it and not spend any time deciphering the text. Unlike another review saying it was simplistic, I find this covers most topics found on the AP exam. It's hard to have too many complaints when the information is accurate and the book is free!
This chemistry book is a great resource to a college chemistry student.  I use this as a quick reference to save time from flipping through pages in my pysical texts books.

This is a very use ful resource for high school teachers and students with the text, theory and graphic to fascilitate learning and also the exercises and activities to make learning more meaningful. I have been using it with my students for a whole school year with wonderful results. I fully recommend this to all my fellows teachers.
I purchased this awhile ago, just now posting my review. It's a good book it breaks down chemistry to its simplest form

Currently using free Kindle edition this with Solid State Chemistry MIT edX course. The currently online text for the course is in a Java sandbox on the course web site; so it is nice to have a chemistry book on my Kindle that doesn't need an internet connection.
It's a very "up-to-date" textbook that is FREE. Thank the writers for this enormous gift they have shared with us.

I bought it as a refresher, something to read on the plane. It doesn't work on Kindle....tables and text get scrambled. You can work it out but quickly get to a point where the pain is way higher than the payoff.
It was an alright book, just wasn't what I was looking for. It's possible that someone else would like it.

I purchased this High School Chemistry book from the Foundation of CK-12 to study up on basic Chemistry.  It starts with discussions of Science and then moves slowly into the meat of the Study.  The explanations are good and I already have a Hard Bound College Text I picked up used I'll move on to when I finish this study.  If you would like to read something to have a basis to build on, this is, in my opinion, a really good place to start.  It is still chemistry, but with each chapter the understanding comes so much easier than my earlier years studying.  I had this digital book added to my library for free, with my Prime Membership.  I like it. A lot!

Author.Name: CDP and his Amazon Habit of purchases!  !

ReviewList.Text: Quality of the ebook format falls far short of a regular book.  But, then again, it was free!
Books do as a book does. This book is as book-like as the rest of them. Unfortunately, there are a few inaccuracies, so be careful. It is free, though.
just about enough math to let you see what the future holds if you are thinking about college level chemistry
Never got it quite right when I had to conform to the ways of the educational system.  At least now I get to see what I missed.  Get it for your own.  It is free!
This was an easy purchase.  I believe it will be a useful book to go along with their existing science program.
Recommended for anyone who wants to learn from beginning or to review chapters. Very easy to read and to understand
This book was pretty cool but it didn't really talk much about atoms. But at least it was free right.

Author.Name: R Joseph, BG Sidharth, and Ashwini Kumar Lal

ReviewList.Text: This had some really good information on and things I was learning in high school I forgot about. Its an excellent refresher course of an adult trying to help your children with their chemistry homework
